summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 between FBI and DOJ personnel coordinating a meeting invitation for victims/survivors of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss verifying victim identities, confirming contact information, and logistical details for sending invitations to victims and their attorneys.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Mentioned as the attorney for a deceased victim, whose client name listing format was referenced for correspondence.

persons.name: Bob Josefsberg
persons.context: An attorney representing multiple victims; FBI personnel were waiting for his current client list to forward for meeting invitations.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: A Victim Specialist who provided a list of clients; mentioned in the context of obtaining the most recent list of clients from Bob Josefsberg.

connections.description: Both are attorneys representing victims/survivors in the Epstein case, as indicated in the email chain discussing attorney client lists.
Brittany Henderson, a Victim Specialist, was obtaining the most recent list of clients from attorney Bob Josefsberg.

events.title: Planned Victim Meeting
events.description: A meeting was being organized for victims/survivors of Jeffrey Epstein, with invitations sent to attorneys and victims.

events.title: Death of a Victim
events.description: Mention of a victim who passed away earlier in 2020, with correspondence about inviting a family member in her place.

keyFacts: The FBI and DOJ were coordinating a meeting for Epstein victims/survivors scheduled for November 12, 2020.
There were challenges in identifying and contacting victims due to duplicate listings, name changes (married names), and some victims being deceased.
Communication was primarily through victims' attorneys, with 14 attorney email addresses and direct emails to only 6 victims identified.
The document reveals internal FBI/DOJ procedures for victim outreach, including data verification and confidentiality protocols.
